etymologies: mid 18th century (in an earlier sense). From French rentrée return, (in a game of cards) card or cards drawn after the initial deal, return to work after a holiday, reappearance at a venue on the part of a performer, use as noun of past participle of rentrer

definitions: A return after an absence from one's accustomed or former place, especially (a) a reappearance at a venue on the part of a performer, etc.; (b) (in France) a return home after an annual holiday.
